p: The insect midgut principal cells are the main cells taking the role of producing the enzymes needed for digestion and then absorbing the nutrients. Therefore, any damages to these cells will lower the activities in digestive enzymes already reported by other researchers [ 15, 31, 61]. The elongation and separation of midgut epithelial cells of G. pyloalis larvae treated by A. annua essential oil were observed in the present study.
